Key Match Events: Pat Cummins c Miller b Shamsi 22 (21b 4x4 0x6 29m)
Josh Hazlewood c Rabada b Shamsi 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m)
Pre-Game Insights: Australia have had the wood over South Africa in the majority of their World Cup meetings but Bavuma's men are in red-hot form of late
Alex Carey has been a bedrock in Australia's team since his standout performance in the 2019 World Cup and he even captained Australia in three ODIs in 2021
Marco Jansen is a pivotal player in South Africa's line-up in this World Cup and was a key contributor in their turnaround in fortunes in the recent series against Australia
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's batters are in dazzling form after piling up 428 against Sri Lanka, with Quinton de Kock, Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram all blazing centuries
Australia's woes have continued with both bat and ball despite the return of key personnel
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lucknow as a surface is a complete unknown for both teams, however both are well aware of the recent dramas surrounding the re-laid strip and the way it played during the IPL this year
David Warner became the quickest player to 1000 World Cup runs, reaching the mark in his 19th innings against India
South Africa's middle order has the highest average (44.6) and run-rate (6.4) over the last four years in ODIs
